alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 7:57AM CDT until March 12 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN...FRANKLIN AND COPIAH COUNTIES... At 756 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gallman to near Mccall Creek to near Kirby, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Crystal Springs, Hazlehurst, Gallman, Mccall Creek, Glancy and Caseyville around 800 AM CDT. Vaughn, Martinsville and Loyd Star around 805 AM CDT. Bude and West Lincoln around 810 AM CDT. Rockport and Little Springs around 820 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Roxie, Meadville, Beauregard and Georgetown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
